resources.string: Principle 7 – Behavior Change & Longer Term Impact
Do you see any information related to sustainability? \n If so, is it certified or supported by standardized methods, governments, NGOs or a scientific organization?

Is this sustainability information focused on the topics that you consider more important about sustainability taking into account the geography where it has been produced and where it will be used or consumed?

Is the sustainability information clear, concise and intuitive enough to understand the environmental performance of this product? Does it allow you to understand the environmental impact of the product?
Do you have enough information to evaluate the sustainability of the product?
Is the information clearly visible? Does it offer complementary information?
Does the sustainability information cover environmental, social and economic aspects? Does it allow you to understand why the product is sustainable within these 3 components?
Does it advice you about how to reduce the impact on sustainability during the use and disposal of it? Does it encourage you to have a more sustainable behavior?
Is the way of transmitting information about sustainability innovative? Does it offer you different channels to access it?
Has the provided information taken into account the opinion and collaboration of the different groups of interest? Does this information make you feel part of a larger movement within sustainability?
Does it allow you to compare the product in terms of sustainability with other products in the same category or sector?
